mapper.select: select count(*) from show_reviews A, show_users B, shows C where A.review_able_status = 'Y' and A.user_no = B.user_no and A.show_no = C.show_no

select * from ( select row_number() over (order by A.review_no desc) as rn, A.review_no as no, A.show_no as showNo, A.user_no as userNo, A.review_rating as rating, A.review_content as content, A.review_able_status as ableStatus, A.review_created_date as createdDate,
B.user_name as userName, B.user_id as id, B.user_password as password, B.user_birth as birth, B.user_tel as tel, B.user_email as email, B.user_address as address, B.email_receiving_consent as emailReceivingConsent, B.sms_receiving_consent as smsReceivingConsent, B.user_available_point as availablePoint, B.user_created_date as userCreatedDate,
C.category_no as categoryNo, C.show_name as showName, C.viewing_no as viewingNo, C.running_time as runningTime, C.poster_img as posterImg, C.begin_date as beginDate, C.end_date as endDate, C.place_no as placeNo, C.attention_img as attentionImg, C.sale_img as saleImg, C.show_detail_img as showDetailImg, C.show_created_date as showCreatedDate from show_reviews A, show_users B, shows C where A.review_able_status = 'Y' and A.user_no = B.user_no and A.show_no = C.show_no ) where
rn >= #{begin} and rn <= #{end}

select A.review_no as no, A.show_no as showNo, A.user_no as userNo, A.review_rating as rating, A.review_content as content, A.review_able_status as ableStatus, A.review_created_date as createdDate,
B.user_name as userName, B.user_id as id, B.user_password as password, B.user_birth as birth, B.user_tel as tel, B.user_email as email, B.user_address as address, B.email_receiving_consent as emailReceivingConsent, B.sms_receiving_consent as smsReceivingConsent, B.user_available_point as availablePoint, B.user_created_date as userCreatedDate,
C.category_no as categoryNo, C.show_name as showName, C.viewing_no as viewingNo, C.running_time as runningTime, C.poster_img as posterImg, C.begin_date as beginDate, C.end_date as endDate, C.place_no as placeNo, C.attention_img as attentionImg, C.sale_img as saleImg, C.show_detail_img as showDetailImg, C.show_created_date as showCreatedDate from show_reviews A, show_users B, shows C where A.review_able_status = #{status} and A.user_no = B.user_no and A.show_no = C.show_no

select review_no as no, show_no as showNo, user_no as userNo, review_rating as rating, review_content as content, review_able_status as ableStatus, review_created_date as createdDate from show_reviews where review_no = #{value}
mapper.insert: insert into show_reviews( review_no, show_no, user_no, review_rating, review_content ) values ( show_review_seq.nextval, #{showNo}, #{userNo}, #{rating}, #{content} )
mapper.update: update show_reviews set review_rating = #{rating}, review_content = #{content}, review_able_status = #{ableStatus} where review_no = #{no}
